_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary
    (a) Accidental Release Prevention Policies:
The facility accidental release prevention policy can be summarized as follows:
7 All facility personnel will be trained in and expected to comply with the site-specific policies pertaining to accidental release prevention.
7 Specific accidental release prevention policy documents are found in:
7 Engineering & Maintenance Procedures
7 Environmental (WWTP) Operating Procedures
7 (Production) Operating Procedures
7 (Sitewide) Risk Management Procedures
    (b) Emergency Response Policies:
The facility emergency response policy can be summarized as follows:
7 All facility personnel will be trained in and expected to comply with the site-specific policies pertaining to emergency response.
7 Specific emergency response policy documents are found in:
7 Engineering & Maintenance Procedures
7 Environmental (WWTP) Operating Procedures
7 (Production) Operating Procedures
7 (Sitewide) Risk Management Procedures
. The specific emergency response document, Risk Management Procedure RM-007
    (c) The stationery Source:
Rhone-Poulenc Surfactants & Specialties, L.P., d/b/a/ Rhodia, Inc., 399 Sims Chapel Road, Spartanburg, SC, 29301.
    (d) [RMP] Regulated substances handled:
  (1) Allyl Alcohol
  (2) Ethylene Oxide
  (3) Propylene Oxide:
    (e) Worst-Case Release Scenario:
See Section4 for details.
    (f) Alternate Release Scenarios:
See Section 4 for details.
  (1) Administrative Controls:
7 Chain-of-command management with specific, overlapping staff assignments for release prevention, emergency response, etc..
7 Twenty-four hour/day, seven day/week facility manning.
7 Active fire watch during holiday shutdown periods.
7 Active membership in and coordination with the Spartanburg County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC), Spartanburg County Emergency Preparedness Department.
7 Active membership in & coordination with the Arkwright Voluntary Fire Department (AVFD).
  (2) Mitigating Measures:
7 State-of-the-art oxide leak d

etection and control systems.
7 Railcar unloading station equipped with a three-car emergency deluge system.
7 Dedicated, diesel-powered, emergency fire water supply system.
7 Emergency alarms throughout the facility.
    (g) General Accidental Release Prevention Program:
. Risk Management Procedure, RM-007, Emergency Response
    (h) Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps:
See Sections (a) & (b) above.
    (i) The Five-Year Accident History: 
7 None
    (j) The Emergency Response Program:
See Section (b) above.
    (k) Planned Changes to Improve Safety:
See Rhodia Spartanburg (Annual) Process Safety Plan for 1999.
